en.vestLength_step1: The person should stand upright in a natural posture.
en.vestLength_step2: Locate the point where the neck meets the shoulder (base of the neck).
en.vestLength_step3: Measure vertically from this point down to the desired vest length.
en.vestLength_step4: Reference point: usually at the waist or about 5 cm below it.
en.shoulderWidth_step1: Find the point where the arm joins the torso (shoulder bone).
en.shoulderWidth_step2: Measure straight across the back from one shoulder to the other.
en.shoulderWidth_step3: Keep the measuring tape parallel to the ground.
en.shoulderWidth_step4: Do not press down; let the tape rest naturally on the shoulders.
en.chest_step1: Wrap the tape around the fullest part of the chest, usually at armpit level.
en.chest_step2: Pass the tape over the most prominent part of the chest.
en.chest_step3: Ensure the tape stays horizontal and level.
en.chest_step4: Do not tighten too much; allow one finger of ease.
en.waist_step1: Locate the natural waist (the narrowest part of the torso).
en.waist_step2: If unclear, measure 2–3 cm above the navel.
en.waist_step3: Wrap the tape around the torso, keeping it parallel to the ground.
en.waist_step4: Ask the client to exhale normally before measuring.
en.pantWaist_step1: Measure where the client normally wears their pants.
en.pantWaist_step2: This may differ from the natural waist.
en.pantWaist_step3: Wrap the tape around the area where the waistband will sit.
en.pantWaist_step4: Add approximately 2 cm of ease for comfort.
en.pantLength_step1: Start measuring from the waistline used for the pant waist.
en.pantLength_step2: Measure vertically down to the outer ankle.
en.pantLength_step3: Ask whether the client prefers the length to reach the shoe or be shorter.
en.inseam_step1: Measure from the crotch seam down to the inner ankle.
en.inseam_step2: The client should stand with feet slightly apart.
en.inseam_step3: This measurement determines the rise height.
en.inseam_step4: Do not stretch the measuring tape.
en.thigh_step1: Measure around the fullest part of the thigh.
en.thigh_step4: Add 3–4 cm of ease for movement.
en.knee_step1: Measure with the leg slightly bent.
en.knee_step2: Wrap the tape around the center of the knee.
en.knee_step3: Ask whether the client prefers a fitted or relaxed knee.
en.boot_step1: Measure the circumference at the narrowest part of the ankle.
en.boot_step2: Or where the pant hem will end.
en.boot_step3: Consider whether the client wears boots or low shoes.
en.boot_step4: Measure over light clothing typically worn.
en.coatLength_step1: Measure from the base of the neck, same reference as the vest.
en.coatLength_step2: Measure vertically down to the desired coat length.
en.coatLength_step3: Common options include: hip length, mid-seat, or mid-thigh.
en.shoulder_step1: Same method as the vest but with higher precision.
en.shoulder_step2: Locate the acromion bone (outermost shoulder point).
en.shoulder_step3: Measure across the back from one shoulder point to the other.
en.shoulder_step4: Note if one shoulder is lower than the other.
en.coatChest_step1: Measure the chest the same way as for the vest.
en.coatChest_step2: Add 8–10 cm of ease to allow layering underneath.
en.coatChest_step3: Ensure the tape passes over the shoulder blades.
en.coatWaist_step1: For coats, this measurement is usually more relaxed.
en.coatWaist_step2: Measure at the same height as the pant waist.
en.coatWaist_step3: Add 6–8 cm of ease for elegance and movement.
en.sleeveLength_step2: Measure down the arm with the arm slightly bent.
en.sleeveLength_step3: End at the wrist bone (base of the hand).
en.sleeveLength_step4: The sleeve should cover 1–2 cm of the shirt cuff.
